title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Make sure code, documentation, comments 80 characters width; Use <- instead = assignment; Always use snake_case (lowercase) instead camelCase.

title: Get started with rmangal
text: Mangal project aims archiving published ecological networks easing retrieval. , Mangal: uses data specification ecological networks (described Poisot et al. 2016); archives ecological networks PostgreSQL database; provides: data explorer visualize download data available; RESTful Application Programming Interface (API); client library Julia: Mangal.jl; client API R: rmangal package described . Currently, 172 datasets including database representing 1300 ecological networks. 2016, first paper describing project published introduced first release rmangal (Poisot et al. 2016). Since , structure database improved (new fields added), several ecological networks added API entirely rewritten. Consequently, first release rmangal obsolete (archived) introduce rmangal v2.0 vignette.

title: Get started with rmangal
text: diagram left side represents structure Mangal database. references included Mangal correspond specific publication includes one several dataset(s). dataset basically collection ecological networks whose nodes interactions (edges) stored separate tables. , briefly describe content table. References – Information pertaining reference (scientific article, book, online website, etc.) characterizing original collection ecological networks. URLs data publication sources included well persistent identifiers (available) digital object identifiers (DOIs). allows user retrieve details original publications using appropriate R packages crossref. Datasets – Metadata datasets attached reference. includes general description networks. Networks – Metadata networks attached dataset. provides sampling location, date specific description network. Nodes – Information population, taxa individu network. node original taxon name documented taxonomic backbone provided services embedded taxize (Chamberlain et al. 2019). Interactions – Information interaction type (e.g. mutualism, predation, etc.), strength, direction interaction two nodes.

title: Get started with rmangal
text: far, rmangal package provides methods get access data store. Data requests (performed via httr::GET()) require authentication. bearer authentication strategy using ORCID credentials (third-party services) implemented POST, DELETE, PUT API operations allow user add delete new ecological data base. features currently included rmangal package, consideration future major releases.

title: Get started with rmangal
text: order efficiently retrieve networks database, rmangal includes 7 search functions querying 5 tables described well table dedicated taxonomy backbone. search_references(): search reference table, instance user can look specific doi; search_datasets(): search among datasets using keyword; search_networks() search_networks_sf(): search networks based keyword geographical area; search_interactions(): list networks containing specific interaction type; search_nodes(): identify nodes based nodes information; search_taxonomy(): identify nodes based taxonomic names unique identifiers. functions return specific class objects information needed retrieve corresponding set ecological networks get_collection(). Hence, user can easily retrieve data two steps: Note one network retrieved, get_collection() returns mgNetwork object, otherwise returns object class mgNetworksCollection collection (list) mgNetwork objects. , exemplify use search functions, get collection networks use packages carry specific analyses.
code: networks <- search_*() %>% get_collection()

title: Get started with rmangal
text: rmangal, every functions queries specific table allow one query time (see section Batch analysis learn perform one query). functions offer two ways query corresponding table: keyword: case, entries returned partial full keyword match strings contained table; custom query: case, entries returned exact matches. Let’s load rmangal well two helper packages:
code: library(rmangal) library(magrittr) # for the pipe %>% library(tibble) # to use tibble (enhanced data frames)

title: Get started with rmangal
text: user can easily identify networks including specific taxonomic entity search_taxonomy(): function allows search specific taxonomic entity using ’s validated name unique identifiers, .e. EOL, TSN, GBIF, COL, BOLD NCBI IDs. Taxon names taxonomy table validated TNRS (see https://tnrs.biendata.org/) /GNR (see https://resolver.globalnames.org/). taxon names table might taxon name documented original publication. order identify relevant networks original name, use [search_nodes()]. validation taxon names performed automated procedure using taxize (Chamberlain et al. 2019) doubt, original names recorded authors regarded reliable information. Please report issue related taxonomy https://github.com/mangal-interactions/contribute/issues/new/choose. Note case, one may need find dataset based original name included publication, case, search_nodes() must used:
code: sr_ficus <- search_taxonomy("Ficus") head(search_taxonomy(tsn = 28749)) #>     id original_name node_level network_id taxonomy_id               created_at               updated_at taxonomy.id taxonomy.name taxonomy.ncbi taxonomy.tsn taxonomy.eol taxonomy.bold taxonomy.gbif #> 1 2629  Acer negundo      taxon         19           2 2019-02-22T18:48:49.433Z 2019-02-22T18:48:49.433Z           2  Acer negundo          4023        28749       583069        100987       3189866 #>                       taxonomy.col taxonomy.rank      taxonomy.created_at      taxonomy.updated_at #> 1 90203e29e2f59e5754167f89b9eba3cc       species 2019-02-21T21:17:12.585Z 2019-06-14T15:20:36.273Z head(search_taxonomy(eol = 583069)) #>     id original_name node_level network_id taxonomy_id               created_at               updated_at taxonomy.id taxonomy.name taxonomy.ncbi taxonomy.tsn taxonomy.eol taxonomy.bold taxonomy.gbif #> 1 2629  Acer negundo      taxon         19           2 2019-02-22T18:48:49.433Z 2019-02-22T18:48:49.433Z           2  Acer negundo          4023        28749       583069        100987       3189866 #>                       taxonomy.col taxonomy.rank      taxonomy.created_at      taxonomy.updated_at #> 1 90203e29e2f59e5754167f89b9eba3cc       species 2019-02-21T21:17:12.585Z 2019-06-14T15:20:36.273Z sr_ficus2 <- search_nodes("Ficus")

title: Get started with rmangal
text: function get_collection() argument as_sf converts network metadata mgNetwork objects sf objects, requires sf installed. allows user easily geolocalize networks retrieved Mangal.
code: # assuming sf and mapview are is loaded (as we did above) mg_lag_sf <- search_datasets(query = 'lagoon') %>% get_collection(as_sf = TRUE) class(mg_lag_sf[[1]]$network) #> [1] "sf"         "data.frame" # let's combine all these sf object into a single one mapView(mg_lag_sf[[1]]$network) + mapView(mg_lag_sf[[2]]$network)

title: Mangal Client
text: Mangal – global ecological interactions database – serializes ecological interaction matrices nodes (e.g. taxon, individuals population) interactions (.e. edges). network, Mangal offers opportunity store study context location, sampling environment, inventory date informations pertaining original publication. every nodes involved ecological networks, Mangal references unique taxonomic identifiers Encyclopedia Life (EOL), Catalogue Life (COL), Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF) etc. can extend nodes informations individual traits. rmangal R client Mangal database provides various functions explore content search functions. offers methods retrieve networks structured mgNetwork mgNetworksCollection S3 objects methods convert mgNetwork class objects order analyze visualize networks properties: igraph, tidygraph, ggraph.

title: Mangal Client
text: far, development version available can installed via remotes 📦
code: R> remotes::install_github("ropensci/rmangal") R> library("rmangal")

title: Mangal Client
text: seven search_*() functions explore content Mangal, instance search_datasets(): first step achieved, networks found can retrieved get_collection() function. get_collection() returns object mgNetwork one network returned, otherwise object mgNetworkCollection, list mgNetwork objects. igraph tidygraph offer powerful features analyze networks rmangal provides functions convert mgNetwork igraph tbl_graph user can easily benefit packages. 📖 Note vignette “Get started rmangal” guide reader several examples provide details rmangal features.
code: R> mgs <- search_datasets("lagoon") Found 2 datasets R> mgn <- get_collection(mgs) R> class(mgn) [1] "mgNetworksCollection" R> mgn A collection of 3 networks  * Network # from data set # * Description: Dietary matrix of the Huizache–Caimanero lagoon * Includes 189 edges and 26 nodes * Current taxonomic IDs coverage for nodes of this network:   --> ITIS: 81%, BOLD: 81%, EOL: 85%, COL: 81%, GBIF: 0%, NCBI: 85% * Published in ref # DOI:10.1016/s0272-7714(02)00410-9  * Network # from data set # * Description: Food web of the Brackish lagoon * Includes 27 edges and 11 nodes * Current taxonomic IDs coverage for nodes of this network:   --> ITIS: 45%, BOLD: 45%, EOL: 45%, COL: 45%, GBIF: 18%, NCBI: 45% * Published in ref # DOI:NA  * Network # from data set # * Description: Food web of the Costal lagoon * Includes 34 edges and 13 nodes * Current taxonomic IDs coverage for nodes of this network:   --> ITIS: 54%, BOLD: 54%, EOL: 54%, COL: 54%, GBIF: 15%, NCBI: 54% * Published in ref # DOI:NA R> ig <- as.igraph(mgn[[1]]) R> class(ig) [1] "igraph" R> library(tidygraph) R> tg <- as_tbl_graph(mgn[[1]]) R> class(tg) [1] "tbl_graph" "igraph"

title: Mangal Client
text: interested pairwise interactions among taxons may consider using rglobi, R package provides interface GloBi infrastructure. GloBi provides open access aggregated interactions heterogeneous sources. contrast, Mangal gives access original networks open gate study ecological networks properties (.e. connectance, degree etc.) along large environmental gradients, wasn’t possible using GloBi infrastructure.

title: Retrieve network information, nodes, edges and references for a given set of Mangal network IDs — get_network_by_id
text: mgNetwork object includes five data frames: network: includes generic information network (as_sf=TRUE object class sf); nodes: information pertaining nodes (includes taxonomic information); interactions: includes ecological interactions attributes; dataset: information pertaining original dataset; reference: details original publication. summary method available objects class mgNetwork object returns following network properties: number nodes; number edges; connectance; linkage density; degree (, total) eigenvector centrality every nodes.

title: Query datasets — search_datasets
text: Identify relevant datasets using keyword custom query. query character string, character columns table searched entries least one partial match found returned. Alternatively, named list can used look exact match specific column (see Details section).

title: Query datasets — search_datasets
code: search_datasets(query, verbose = TRUE, ...)

title: Query datasets — search_datasets
text: query either character string including single keyword named list containing custom query (see details section ). Note empty character string passed, datasets available returned. verbose logical. extra information reported progress? ... arguments passed httr::GET().

title: Query datasets — search_datasets
text: object class mgSearchDatasets, basically data.frame object including datasets corresponding query. dataset entry, networks original reference attached.

title: Query datasets — search_datasets
text: query named list, name  used one following: id: unique identifier dataset name: name dataset date: date (YYYY-mm-dd) corresponding publication description: brief description data set ref_id: Mangal identifier dataset Note lists one element, first element used, others ignored. Examples covering custom queries provided .

title: Query datasets — search_datasets
text: https://mangal.io/#/ https://mangal-interactions.github.io/mangal-api/#datasets

title: Query interactions — search_interactions
text: Search specific interactions using keyword specific type interactions (e.g. mutualism). query character string, character columns table searched entries least one partial match found returned. Alternatively, named list can used look exact match specific column (see Details section)

title: Query interactions — search_interactions
code: search_interactions(   query,   type = NULL,   expand_node = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Query interactions — search_interactions
text: query either character string including single keyword named list containing custom query (see details section ). Note empty character string passed, datasets available returned. type character one interactions type available (see details). Note query ignored type used. expand_node logical. function returned extra information pertaining nodes? Default set FALSE, means Mangal IDs nodes returned. verbose logical. extra information reported progress? ... arguments passed httr::GET().

title: Query interactions — search_interactions
text: object class mgSearchInteractions, .e. data.frame object including interactions. networks interactions involved also attached data.frame.

title: Query interactions — search_interactions
text: Names list match one column names within table. interaction table, : id: unique identifier interaction; attr_id: identifier specific attribute; direction: edge direction ("directed", "undirected" "unknown"); network_id: Mangal network identifier; node_from: node id interaction end ; node_to: node interaction end ; type: use argument type instead. Note lists one element, first element used, others ignored. type interactions (argument type) currently available following "competition"; "amensalism"; "neutralism"; "commensalism"; "mutualism"; "parasitism"; "predation"; "herbivory"; "symbiosis"; "scavenger"; "detritivore".

title: Query interactions — search_interactions
text: https://mangal.io/#/ https://mangal-interactions.github.io/mangal-api/#taxonomy

title: Query interactions — search_interactions

title: Query networks — search_networks
text: Search networks using keyword, custom query spatial object query character string, character columns table searched entries least one partial match found returned. Alternatively, named list can used look exact match specific column (see Details section)

title: Query networks — search_networks
code: search_networks(query, verbose = TRUE, ...)  search_networks_sf(query_sf, verbose = TRUE, ...)

title: Query networks — search_networks
text: query either character string including single keyword named list containing custom query (see details section ), spatial object (see description query_sf). Note empty character string passed, datasets available returned. verbose logical. extra information reported progress? ... arguments passed httr::GET(). query_sf spatial object class sf used search specific geographical area.

title: Query networks — search_networks
text: object class mgSearchNetworks, data.frame object networks informations

title: Query networks — search_networks
text: Names list match one column names within table. networks table, id: unique identifier network; all_interactions: false interaction can considered real false interaction dataset_id: identifier dataset; public: network publicly available; Note lists one element, first element used, others ignored. example provided .

title: Query networks — search_networks
text: search_networks_sf(): Search networks within spatial object passed argument. Note sf must installed use function.

title: Query networks — search_networks
text: https://mangal.io/#/ https://mangal-interactions.github.io/mangal-api/#networks

title: Query nodes — search_nodes
text: Search networks querying nodes table. query character string, character columns table searched entries least one partial match found returned. Alternatively, named list can used look exact match specific column (see Details section)

title: Query nodes — search_nodes
code: search_nodes(query, verbose = TRUE, ...)

title: Query nodes — search_nodes
text: query either character string including single keyword named list containing custom query (see details section ). Note empty character string passed, datasets available returned. verbose logical. extra information reported progress? ... arguments passed httr::GET().

title: Query nodes — search_nodes
text: object class mgSearchNodes, basically data.frame object including taxa matching query corresponding information. networks taxa involved also attached data.frame.

title: Query nodes — search_nodes
text: Names list match one column names within table. networks table, : id: unique identifier nodes; original_name: taxonomic name original publication; node_level: either population, taxon individual; network_id: Mangal network identifier. Note lists one element, first element used, others ignored. example provided .

title: Query nodes — search_nodes
text: https://mangal.io/#/ https://mangal-interactions.github.io/mangal-api/#nodes

title: Query references — search_references
text: Search specific reference using key word Digital Object Identifier (DOI). query character string, character columns table searched entries least one partial match found returned. Alternatively, named list can used look exact match specific column (see Details section).

title: Query references — search_references
code: search_references(query, doi = NULL, verbose = TRUE, ...)

title: Query references — search_references
text: query either character string including single keyword named list containing custom query (see details section ). Note empty character string passed, datasets available returned. doi character Digital Object Identifier  (DOI) article. Note query ignored doi specified. verbose logical. extra information reported progress? ... arguments passed httr::GET().

title: Query references — search_references
text: object class mgSearchReferences, list includes wide range details associated reference, including datasets networks related publication included Mangal database.

title: Query references — search_references
text: Names list match one column names within table. reference table, : id: unique identifier reference first_author: first author doi: use doi instead jstor: JSTOR identifier year: year publication. Note lists one element, first element used, others ignored. example provided .

title: Query references — search_references
text: https://mangal.io/#/ https://mangal-interactions.github.io/mangal-api/#references

title: Query taxonomy — search_taxonomy
text: Search network taxon names unique taxonomic identifiers. function offers opportunity retrieve taxon based () known identifier taxonomic serial number (TSN), GBIF ID etc. (ii) text search using partial match. look list arguments see complete list identifiers accessible. unique identifier argument used (.e. tsn etc.), query ignored. Moreover, several taxonomic identifiers specified, first one considered.

title: Query taxonomy — search_taxonomy
code: search_taxonomy(   query,   tsn = NULL,   gbif = NULL,   eol = NULL,   col = NULL,   bold = NULL,   ncbi = NULL,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Query taxonomy — search_taxonomy
text: query character string including single keyword. Note empty character string passed, datasets available returned. tsn numeric. Unique taxonomic identifier Integrated Taxonomic Information System (https://www.itis.gov). gbif numeric. Unique taxonomic identifier Global Biodiversity Information Facility (https://www.gbif.org). eol numeric. Unique taxonomic identifier Encyclopedia Life (https://eol.org). col numeric. Unique taxonomic identifier Catalogue Life (https://www.catalogueoflife.org). bold numeric. Unique taxonomic identifier Barcode Life (http://www.boldsystems.org). ncbi numeric. Unique taxonomic identifier National Center Biotechnology Information (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov). verbose logical. extra information reported progress? ... arguments passed httr::GET().

title: Query taxonomy — search_taxonomy
text: object class mgSearchTaxonomy, data.frame including taxa matching query.

title: Query taxonomy — search_taxonomy
text: Taxon names taxonomy table validated TNRS (see https://tnrs.biendata.org /GNR might taxon name documented original publication. order identify relevant networks original name, use search_nodes(). validation taxon names performed automated procedure doubt, original names recorded authors regarded reliable information. Please report issue related taxonomy https://github.com/mangal-interactions/contribute/issues/new/choose/.

title: rmangal 2.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2023-03-30 Remove USAboundaries Taxize list ‘Suggested’ packages (see #114).

title: rmangal 2.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2023-01-27 Fixtures now written JSON (see #112).

title: rmangal 2.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-05-15 inherits() now used test classes. purrr longer listed imported package. Add lintr workflow automatically check stylistic errors. Summary method mgNetwork objects now reports nodes properly (see nodes #108).

title: rmangal 2.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-11-24 examples within \donttest tag (see #100). get_collection() methods always return object class mgNetworksCollection (see #100). get_network_by_id() gains argument force_collection force class collection (see #100). Vignette now precomputed (see #100). Tests now use vcr (see #100). Travis Appveyor removed, use GitHub Actions (see #100). avail_type() longer exported.

title: rmangal 2.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2020-10-13 Fix minor bug search_datasets() related absent networks attached dataset (see #97 #98); Update Travis CI environment test (travis.yml).

title: rmangal 2.0.1
text: Fix minor bug print method mgNetwork objects see #94; Fix broken URIs README; Remove mapview vignette (CRAN issue missing PhantomJS).

title: rmangal 2.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-10-03 Revisions see https://github.com/ropensci/software-review/issues/332; add summary method [#87]; mg_to_igraph now .igraph(); search_references() rewritten [#85]; vignette now includes examples use tigygraph ggraph; pkgdown website now deployed Travis CI [#86]; geom column removed mgSearchInteractions objects; sf features used search_networks_sf() argument as_sf set TRUE [#89]; query spatial (sf) objects handle query_networks_sf() now exported.

title: rmangal 1.9.0.9000
text: Version submitted ROpenSci review; Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
